product.title: Lenovo Legion Pro 5i Gen 9 Gaming Laptop, 16" WQXGA(2560 x 1600) 240Hz, Intel 24-Core i9-14900HX, GeForce RTX 4070, 64 GB DDR5, 8 TB SSD, 4-Zone RGB Backlit, WiFi 6E, Win 11 Pro, Free Lifetime Office

product.categories_flat: Electronics > Computers & Accessories > Computers & Tablets > Laptops > Traditional Laptops
product.description:
Statement:
Original Seal is opened for upgrade ONLY. If the computer has modifications, then the manufacturer box is opened for it to be tested and inspected and to install the upgrades to achieve the specifications as advertised.


GENERAL INFORMATION

Brand: Lenovo

Model Number: 83DF00AQUS

Series: Lenovo Legion Pro 5i Gen 9 Gaming Laptop- Intel 14th Gen Core i9- NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8GB

Color: Onyx Grey

Operating System: Windows 11 Pro


PROCESSOR

CPU: 14th Gen Intel i9-14900HX processor

Number of Cores: 24

Number of Threads: 32

E-Core Max Turbo Frequency: 4.1 GHz

P-Core Max Turbo Frequency: 5.8 GHz


GRAPHICS

Graphics Type: Dedicated

GPU: NVIDIA Geforce RTX 4070

Graphics RAM: 8 GB GDDR6


DISPLAY

Display Size: 16 inches

Resolution: 2560 x 1600 (WQXGA)

Refresh Rate: 240 Hz

Display Screen Type: IPS, Anti-glare, 100% DCI-P3,HDR 400,Low Blue Light, High Gaming Performance 

Brightness: 500 nits


MEMORY & STORAGE

Capacity: 64 GB DDR5

Storage: 8 TB SSD


PORTS

1 x Ethernet (RJ45)

1x USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 (DisplayPort 1.4)

1x USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 (DisplayPort 1.4 + Power Delivery 140W)

2 x USB-A 3.2 Gen 1

2 x USB-A 3.2 Gen 1(Always On USB 5V2A)

1 x Electronic e-shutter switch

1 x Headset (Headphone and Microphone Combo) Port

1x Power input

1 x HDMI 2.1


WIRELESS

Wi-Fi 6E

Bluetooth 5.1 


FEATURES

Keyboard: 4-Zone RGB Backlit

Audio Technology: 2x2W speaker system w/ Nahimic Audio

Camera: 1080P FHD with Electronic Privacy Shutter and Microphone


PHYSICAL SPECIFICATIONS

Length: 14.3 inches

Width: 10.25 inches

Height: 0.88 -1.05 inches

Weight: 5.51 lbs
feature_bullets: High-Performance: The Lenovo legion pro 5i Gaming Laptop is engineered to deliver unparalleled gaming performance. Equipped with Intel i9-14900HX, Up to Turbo Boost 5.8 GHz, 24 cores, 32 threads. With its high core count and advanced architecture, it effortlessly handles demanding tasks, from gaming to content creation, ensuring smooth multitasking and responsive computing experiences

RTX 4070 Graphics & 16-inch WQXGA 240Hz Display : Equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8 GB GDDR6, this Legion Pro 5i Gen 9 delivers incredible gaming performance, real-time ray tracing, and AI-powered enhancements for lifelike visuals.The 16" WQXGA (2560 x 1600) screen with a fast 240Hz refresh rate offers crystal-clear resolution, vibrant colors, and sharp detail, ideal for gamers and creatives. Includes a 4-zone RGB backlit keyboard, enhancing your gaming setup with customizable lighting

AI-Optimized Performance & Cooling: Stay cool under pressure with Legion ColdFront, featuring phase-change materials, hybrid heat pipes, and ultra-thin 3D blade fans. The Lenovo AI Engine+ dynamically optimizes FPS, thermals, and power efficiency for sustained peak performance during marathon sessions

Gamer Keyboard & Immersive Audio:Dominate with the Legion TrueStrike keyboard—featuring 1.5mm key travel, swappable keycaps, and a full-size layout for precision control. Customize your battlestation with Lenovo Spectrum RGB lighting and enjoy smooth navigation on the large Mylar touchpad.Nahimic by SteelSeries delivers cinematic 3D audio, enhancing every in-game sound for total immersion. Communicate clearly with teammates—hear every detail, react faster, and play smarter

Windows 11 Pro & Lifetime Office: Embrace the future of gaming with a laptop with Windows 11 Pro. Experience a seamless computing experience with a sleek and intuitive interface, improved gaming performance, and enhanced security features.Get your hands on Microsoft Office lifetime license for free, forever, enhancing your office life with greater ease and efficiency! Please DO NOT install Office 365, which invalidates the Office license

RTX 4070 Graphics & 16-inch WQXGA 240Hz Display : Equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8 GB GDDR6, this Legion Pro 5i Gen 9 delivers incredible gaming performance, real-time ray tracing, and AI-powered enhancements for lifelike visuals.The 16" WQXGA (2560 x 1600) screen with a fast 240Hz refresh rate offers crystal-clear resolution, vibrant colors, and sharp detail, ideal for gamers and creatives. Includes a 4-zone RGB backlit keyboard, enhancing your gaming setup with customizable lighting. High-Performance: The Lenovo legion pro 5i Gaming Laptop is engineered to deliver unparalleled gaming performance. Equipped with Intel i9-14900HX, Up to Turbo Boost 5.8 GHz, 24 cores, 32 threads. With its high core count and advanced architecture, it effortlessly handles demanding tasks, from gaming to content creation, ensuring smooth multitasking and responsive computing experiences.

top_reviews.title: Quiet, fast, and smooth-running laptop
top_reviews.body: I've been using this laptop for just over a month now. I bought it primarily for gaming. I have no complaints so far! I'm loving this thing.  It runs super smoothly and is fast. Great quality graphics. I do use a cooling board underneath it, but even before I received that, the fan was already pretty quiet.  I will say, the battery-life definitely does not last long if you're gaming, but I expect that, and I don't leave the house with it so am able to keep it charged, so that's not a personal complaint for me, but definitely something for others to be wary of. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I've been using this laptop for just over a month now. I bought it primarily for gaming. I have no complaints so far! I'm loving this thing.

It runs super smoothly and is fast. Great quality graphics. I do use a cooling board underneath it, but even before I received that, the fan was already pretty quiet.

I will say, the battery-life definitely does not last long if you're gaming, but I expect that, and I don't leave the house with it so am able to keep it charged, so that's not a personal complaint for me, but definitely something for others to be wary of.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023

top_reviews.title: Impressed with the laptop and seller
top_reviews.body: I was hesitant on purchasing such a high price item from Amazon. The laptop was expensive but laptops are.... and this was a better price then any store I went to. Glad I took the chance, the laptop works great. I had an issue with the charger not working after a few days, contacted seller and they refunded money to purchase a replacement charger... not the sellers fault at all. They could of easily told me to contact lenovo for warranty, but didn't... I appreciate the quick response from them and their professional courtesy. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I was hesitant on purchasing such a high price item from Amazon. The laptop was expensive but laptops are.... and this was a better price then any store I went to. top_reviews.title: My husband loves this
top_reviews.body: I purchased this as a gift for my husband. Playing games on this laptop is so much fun. It is a high-performing laptop at a reasonable price. I am looking into getting one for myself. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023

top_reviews.title: Not for the unlucky.
top_reviews.body: This computer sucks so bad. There were so many good reviews and so little bad ones I was like “Huh what’re the odds mine will suck too” surprise. Mine also sucks too. I’m now paying off a loan on a computer that can’t handle CAPCUT OR DOWNLOADING DRIVERS(?!) like is this real?! The laptop was fine at the beginning, it would do a random restart once or twice everyone once in a while. It now can’t do simple things without the fans sounding like a jet engine and it restarting itself. This is so absolutely frustrating on so many levels I legitimately cannot express it over text. $1,000 dollars for a computer that struggles with downloading stuff off the internet, how useful. I’m trying to fix it and I’ll update if I can fix it. I wish I could get a refund. I don’t know if I could because it’s “modified” I guess. My HP Pavilion that was $500 and several years old handles better than this computer. If you have bad luck, go get a computer from a trusted source without any modifications or you’ll be throwing your broke self into more debt for a useless piece of garbage. I use it SOLELY for video editing, there is literally nothing else on this computer. I have CapCut and the media needed for video editing. THAT’S IT and yet the computer can’t deliver what I want. I’m so disappointed. Since I’m already broke because $1,000 dollars isn’t just /something I have/ I can’t afford to go get it looked at and I’m stupid so of course I’m not gonna understand anything. I buy stuff so that it’s done for me because it’s not my level of expertise. Like said I’ll update when or IF I get justice. Like it working or a refund or something, but with the way things are going I’m thinking nothing is gonna happen and this will be just another experience to throw into the pile of things I cry myself to sleep thinking about.  EDIT 9/5/23 Still having trouble but recently had a breakthrough!!! So I bought fans for the laptop, surprise!! didn’t work and it still kept rebooting on me randomly so I just set it under my bed to rot before I would break it over my knee. So it sat there for a while and randomly a few nights ago I was telling my friend about it and I pulled it out and it was working completely fine, like, not a single problem at all and I was like this laptop is trying to make me look bad wtf. I was amazed though and so happy. So I pulled it out today to use it and still no problems, but then the battery got low so I plugged it in and there it goes rebooting. IT WAS IT BEING PLUGGED INTO THE CHARGER?!!?? I tested it a few times then and every-time without fail the MOMENT i would put that bad boy charger in the rebooting parade would commence. My laptop came with a fault that has something to do with the charger and power and stuff because it would reboot randomly at the very beginning and then it got worse overtime. So now that I have discovered that there is hope I will be going and getting it checked out in hopes of it being a cheap fix. I will be keeping the one star though because in the end it came to me broken and has caused me more grief than I would like to admit and my opinion of it being a gamble still stands as other people have also had theirs arrive broken and stuff. TLDR; It’s a good laptop but don’t take the risk of it showing up broken, it’s NOT worth it. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
This computer sucks so bad. There were so many good reviews and so little bad ones I was like “Huh what’re the odds mine will suck too” surprise. Mine also sucks too. I’m now paying off a loan on a computer that can’t handle CAPCUT OR DOWNLOADING DRIVERS(?!) like is this real?!
The laptop was fine at the beginning, it would do a random restart once or twice everyone once in a while. It now can’t do simple things without the fans sounding like a jet engine and it restarting itself. This is so absolutely frustrating on so many levels I legitimately cannot express it over text. $1,000 dollars for a computer that struggles with downloading stuff off the internet, how useful.
I’m trying to fix it and I’ll update if I can fix it. I wish I could get a refund. I don’t know if I could because it’s “modified” I guess. My HP Pavilion that was $500 and several years old handles better than this computer.
If you have bad luck, go get a computer from a trusted source without any modifications or you’ll be throwing your broke self into more debt for a useless piece of garbage.
I use it SOLELY for video editing, there is literally nothing else on this computer. I have CapCut and the media needed for video editing. THAT’S IT and yet the computer can’t deliver what I want. I’m so disappointed.
Since I’m already broke because $1,000 dollars isn’t just /something I have/ I can’t afford to go get it looked at and I’m stupid so of course I’m not gonna understand anything. I buy stuff so that it’s done for me because it’s not my level of expertise.
Like said I’ll update when or IF I get justice. Like it working or a refund or something, but with the way things are going I’m thinking nothing is gonna happen and this will be just another experience to throw into the pile of things I cry myself to sleep thinking about.

EDIT 9/5/23
Still having trouble but recently had a breakthrough!!! So I bought fans for the laptop, surprise!! didn’t work and it still kept rebooting on me randomly so I just set it under my bed to rot before I would break it over my knee. So it sat there for a while and randomly a few nights ago I was telling my friend about it and I pulled it out and it was working completely fine, like, not a single problem at all and I was like this laptop is trying to make me look bad wtf. I was amazed though and so happy. So I pulled it out today to use it and still no problems, but then the battery got low so I plugged it in and there it goes rebooting. IT WAS IT BEING PLUGGED INTO THE CHARGER?!!?? I tested it a few times then and every-time without fail the MOMENT i would put that bad boy charger in the rebooting parade would commence.
My laptop came with a fault that has something to do with the charger and power and stuff because it would reboot randomly at the very beginning and then it got worse overtime.
So now that I have discovered that there is hope I will be going and getting it checked out in hopes of it being a cheap fix.
I will be keeping the one star though because in the end it came to me broken and has caused me more grief than I would like to admit and my opinion of it being a gamble still stands as other people have also had theirs arrive broken and stuff.
TLDR; It’s a good laptop but don’t take the risk of it showing up broken, it’s NOT worth it.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2023

top_reviews.title: Great starter laptop
top_reviews.body: I bought this as a go between for gaming and light 3d modeling and programming. I can play any games I’ve tried such as halo, call of duty and such. Also has no problems running assemblies in fusion 360. Decent value when on sale. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023

top_reviews.title: Good Laptop, Fast, and Reliable
top_reviews.body: I have had the laptop for three weeks and use it primarily for digital art. Adobe products work quickly and with no crashing so far. Graphics are perfect for art and for games I have played. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023

top_reviews.title: I love this laptop !
top_reviews.body: I absolutely love this laptop so far. It just came yesterday. It’s a big upgrade from my old desktop. I’m a music producer and I need a quick computer, that can handle a lot at once. And this laptop literally meets all of those expectations. Windows 11 reminds me of an apple device. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2022

top_reviews.title: Very Nice
top_reviews.body: It came boxed and wrapped very well. It runs whisper quiet and has good speed. I saw where people complained about uploading onto it and it all going into OneDrive. All you have to do is uninstall OneDrive before you start putting things on the computer, no big deal. Read more
